cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning north-northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast and inland across Louisiana and Mississippi

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also Storm Surge Warning 2–4 ft)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from east of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; Hurricane Warning from High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward through all of Louisiana to coastal Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with occasional gusts near 50 kt possible Friday afternoon through late Friday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible at the mouth of the Mississippi River, including Plaquemines coastal areas
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals possible, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous seas, high surf and rip currents hampering vessel movements and port operations
